abstracts.cdata!:
Although the environmental impact due to
            construction works is expected to be small, the
            infrastructure rehabilitation works to increase water
            efficiency in the main, and field canals on demonstration
            farms, does not include investments in dams, nor
            construction of new canals, to allow increased water
            abstraction from main sources. Neither does it include
            resettlement plans. Hence, several environmental issues have
            been identified in the Environmental Management Plan (EMP),
            namely, ineffective water resources management, and,
            increasing areas affected by water-logging and soil
            salination, due to inefficient irrigation water management,
            and improper use of drainage systems. Furthermore, soil
            erosion, and town waste water discharges into major rivers,
            will increase water pollution. This EMP discusses measures
            to mitigate adverse impacts on the environment, recommending
            during construction, a) the dampening of surfaces to avoid
            dust pollution, b) that works be adjusted to daytime
            schedules to ease noise disturbances, and, c) that solid
            wastes be disposed of in accordance with environmental
            regulations. Vegetation degradation should be replaced
            and/or replanted. Sludge drainage will be seasonally
            controlled, according to operation and maintenance
            practices, while affected crop lands will undergo periodic
            water, and soil testing, by regional laboratories. An
            awareness campaign is recommended.
